args: The hell's gotten into you, kid?
Huh? Am I doing it wrong?
Ha ha! Welcome back, Maribelle.\nAnd these must be your friends.
Yep! I brought some of my new\nfriends from school!
Woooah. You must be SUPER important\nif you've got friends who live in a castle.
Hee hee! Oh, and can we please have\nsomething to eat, Cleo?
When I heard you were bringing some\nfriends, I set about making a number of\ndifferent cookies.
Still, why don't we take these cookies\nto the forest and have them with tea?
I'm sure your animal friends\nare quite eager to see you.
Aw, there's a deer... Whoa, and a BEAR!
Are these really your friends, Maribelle?
It's okayâ€”they can be your friends, too.\nJust put your hands out and pet 'em.
A-are you serious? That's a BEAR!
It's fine. We'll do it together.
Hee hee! And now that you're all friends,\nwe can play together!
I'll teach you all our forest games!
Well, they seem to be having fun.
It's nice to see so many friends together.
Maribelle now has friends in the forest,\nthe castle, AND the school.
And that circle will only keep growing.
She has a special talent, it seems.
What are you all talking about over here?\nCome play with us already!
Heh. Sorry. We were just impressed about\nhow many friends you have now.
At first I was really scared that it wouldn't\nwork out, but then it did!
And now I want even MORE friends!
I wanna make friends with everyone\nin the entire world!
Well, if anyone can do it, it's you.
How wonderful it would be if the whole\nworld could become friends.
Though I agree, such an ideal has\nnever felt so far away as it does in\nthis war-torn world we live in.
Maybe we just think that way\nbecause we aren't Maribelle.
She's pure, innocent, and devoted in\neverything she doesâ€”she might actually\nbe able to pull it off.
Boys and girls, people and animals!\nGather around me!
I've got SO MANY friends, and I'm going\nto get SO MANY more! I can't wait!
